choices: He gains muscle everytime he hits a Drimogemon
1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.content:
Veemon decided to head towards a yellow booth that were between two others, green and blue. It was a whack-a-mole booth consisting of three old-school styled machines with nine holes and a electronic scoreboard and timer that altogether creating the counter of the booth, each with its own cushioned stool to sit on. The differences were mostly that the fake or toy hammers used were shaped to look like Zudomon's and the moles were modeled as Drimogemon. In the back of the booth were a wall of prizes. Of course, there were the stuffed digimon toys, ranging from small to king size, but there were also a table for other prizes such as fake toy laser/guns, small figurines and such. Though there were some odd stuff like a bottle of pills, some kind protein shake, a bag of powder, and more. Stranger still is that they were part of the large prizes. Who would want to win something like that? It was question that seeped into his mind at that moment and was curious about what makes them special as well.

He then plopped down on the center stool and grabbed the handle of the hammer that was tied to the front of the machine. He also caught a glimpse of a hanged sign explaining the score and prize system: Each Drimogemon hit is equal to 5 points, 20+ points = small prize, 50+ points = medium prize, and 100 points = large prize, and under a time limit of 2 minutes. He was now ready to play with hammer in tow and fortunately, he didn't have to use any coins to play it as he pressed start on the machine below the holes.

How does he gain muscle?

He was racking up the points, passing 20 and then 50 during the first minute alone. He then surpassed 100 as the time dwindled down. A buzzer rang loud signaling the end of the game. He finished with a record high of 200 points total! He had more than enough to choose from the large prize table.

He looked over the prizes that were available, more or less the odd ones present. There was a bottle of pills, some kind protein shake, a bag of powder, an energy drink, a syringe filled with some kind of liquid, a pair of briefs, a jockstrap and a tub of cream. 1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.content:
Veemon walked down aisle of game booths until he approached a few shooting galleries with a particular theme.

One was called Buckshot. It was definitely hunter theme with the booth looking like a forest background with bushes and pine trees. There was a choice of shot gun and rifle to shoot targets which were bears, deer, and little forest critters like squirrels, rabbits and skunks.

Another was called Invasion, a space alien themed gallery. It had a space background with stars and planets and the landscape was grey with craters indicating that it took place on the moon. The guns were 50s movie Sci-fi looking and the targets were aliens of different shapes of sizes; some were slimy with tentacles, others looked like little green or grey men, and others were meteor golems. Also, the game worked more like laser tag too.

The next one was western theme called High Noon Saloon. The backdrop was in front of a Wild West saloon with windows on first and second floor where bandit targets would obviously pop out. There were some barrels along with a horse stationed at a post, stray tumbleweed, and a water tower that settled to the right of the saloon. There was also a track that signaled that bandits on horseback would appear across the field. The guns used were a choice between a rifle and a six-shooter.

And finally, there was Zombie Zone. This was a pretty unique one. The backdrop was a cityscape street with tall glass and concrete buildings that were cracked and demolished, the street asphalt were damaged with tons of potholes, and wrecked cars were on fire. There were also barbed wire barriers too. There were riot guns mounted on the counter and the obvious zombie targets along with military and police zombies too.

Veemon decided to take a crack at one of the shooting galleries. Which one does he choose?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.title: Shooting Gallery

1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.content:
He went over to the Buckshot gallery and sat on a stool next to the counter where the guns are mounted. He also took notice of the Start button that starts up the game in between the firearms. The other things that caught his eye were the score chart and the prize table.

The score chart was labeled as followed:

Bears = 100 pts

Deer = 50pts

Rabbits/Squirrels/Skunks = 20 pts

It seemed reasonable enough, but the prize table was something else entirely.

Instead of the usual items you see as prizes like stuffed animals or novelty toys, these were strange to offer as prizes. The four peculiar items were laid on the table: a crystal vial of liquid, a jockstrap, a bottle of pills and a syringe filled with some kind of blue liquid. Veemon wondered who would want prizes like that. But he just shrugged it off. He then pressed the Start button.

1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.title: Fortune Teller machine?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.content:
Veemon went over to a section that contained a row of game booths and walked pass them from the skee balls to the water guns to the whack-a-moles. Soon, he found himself at the end of the line of game booths and next to the last one was something odd.

It was a fortune teller machine. Inside the machine there was an animatronic Tapirmon with its eyes closed and wearing a purple turban with its hoofs around a crystal ball in front of it. Lights around the wooden box frame glowed dimly as well as the crystal ball inside. There was sign above the box that said “The Great Tapirmon! Make All Your Wishes Come True!” A couple of red buttons lit up that started the machine. Taking a closer look in the back of it and to his surprise the machine was unplugged yet still managed to be working and functional.

Though as surprising as this was working, he was curious about the claim of making wishes come true. Was it true? It wouldn’t hurt to try since it seemed to be free as it didn’t seem to have any coin slots whatsoever.

He pressed the red start button and the animatronic and lights acted up, flashing, glowing, and making sounds. The Tapirmon’s eyes opened to reveal them to be glowing and opened its mouth to make low bellowing sound that made him nervous and creeped out. Soon, everything halted and died down and a ding was heard. A slip of paper came out of a hole below the red buttons.

He took the paper and read its contents: “Make a Wish.”

Is that all? But now what is he going to wish for? He did have an idea about wishing for muscles and becoming a very strong mon. It was mostly to impress Gatomon as well as to experience such power and strength.

He then spoke, “I wish _____.”
1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.title: The Great Tapirmon

choices: He instantly becomes taller and muscular
He gradually gains height and muscle over time
1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.content: After he spoke out his wish, what his rate of growth?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.title: I was tall and muscular

choices: He gets something to eat and drink
1213322222222222222222222222222222222221.content:
“I wish I was tall and muscular!” he said aloud.

As if it had heard him, the animatronic reacted and activated itself up again. It did the same thing as before with the flashing lights and the haunting bellowing sound coming out of the Tapirmon’s fake mouth. It still unnerved him and gave him chills. After it was done, a small ting sound was heard and a small piece of paper came out of a slit located beneath the buttons. He took and read it.

“Wish granted? Huh?”

He looked puzzled and then down all over his body. Nothing seemed to happen after a few minutes and didn’t feel any different nor feel any much change. Did it need time to take in effect? Did it even work at all?

With a sigh, he decided to move on to other things and not worry about it.

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: MG Jockstrap?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
"Can't believe I've agreed to that bet..." grumbled Veemon as he walked along the river's edge. He was in a dense forest region of the digital world, following a river upstream to waterfall base, his destination. He had recently lost a bet to Gomamon in an rice ball eating contest and the white seal digimon bet that if he beat him, Veemon had to snatch Leomon's jockstrap. Fortunately, or unfortunately for Veemon, Gomamon knew the spot where the anthropomorphic lion usually hangs out.

He had been walking for about over an hour until he could hear the crashing of water on water and rocks. He was getting close. He then decided to hide among the bushes and trees to be out of sight. He then approached near the edges of the base, and what he saw told that Gomamon's words about the lion's whereabouts were true. The muscular lion was in the buff, sitting cross-legged on a giant rock under the falling water with eyes closed as if in deep thought. After seeing him, Veemon couldn't help but feel a bit envious since he wished he had muscles like that to become stronger and to attract plenty of womon and etc. He then snapped out such thoughts and started to see if the jock was anywhere around. He then spotted it within long black pants and next to the lion's weapon. His eyes went back to Leomon who still had his eyes closed.

This was the perfect opportunity to get the jockstrap and get out before Leomon notices. Did he get caught?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: To Steal a Lion's Jock

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Thankfully, the distance between him and jock was just a mere few feet. While inching out of the bush he hid in, he looked back at the still meditating lion mon and back at the jockstrap. Nervous like Indiana Jones about to grab booby trapped treasure. It was now or never.

With a hasty claw, he snatched the strap from its resting place and ran away as fast as he could back into the forest in the opposite direction. He kept running over thick roots and under brush, taking quick glances behind him to see if he was being pursued. Soon, energy was leaving him and he had to slow down to take a breather. He finally stopped in a small clearing surrounded by some oaks, elms and bushes and by the sound of rushing water, the river was nearby to the west of him.

He took a sigh of relief when he confirmed that he wasn't followed. Now taking a break, he examined the jockstrap even further. “Dramon destroyers? What are they doing here?” Veemon said.

“Dunno. I stumbled upon these things accidentally. Already tried pulling them out of the stone, but no luck. Not to mention…”Gomamon said hinting towards his flippers.

“So you think one of us will be able to do it?” Agumon piped up.

“Maybe since you guys seem much capable of doing it”

“I don’t know about that it seems stuck pretty deep.” Gabumon spoke up as he approached and examined the stuck weapons. “Though I guess it wouldn’t hurt to try. So who’s going first?”

“I’ll go first since my mega-digivolution is equipped with it.” Agumon volunteered as he went up and put his arms into the bladed gauntlets.

“RAARGH!” Agumon groaned and grunted as he tried his hardest to yank the destroyers out of the stone, but after a few minutes, he tired himself out without any results, not even a budge. “They’re stuck in there tight!” he exclaimed.

“Okay, I’ll go next!” Gabumon volunteered as he gripped the weapon and tried his best to pull it out of the stone. With every grunt and tug, he soon tired himself out and panted, yielding no results from his attempt. “Yup, they’re definitely in too deep.”

“Okay, now it’s my turn!” Veemon confidently declared as he stepped up to the plate despite what the others said. He gripped the gauntlets and pulled with all his might.

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Halloween was only a couple weeks away as well as the costume party at Ken Ichijouji’s so Veemon took this time to find a costume.

It was in the middle of the day in the Digiworld in a metropolis area. The dragon rookie traversed the crowded streets surrounded by concrete, brick and glass buildings. He passed by many clothing stores, retail stores and restaurants until he spotted what he was looking for, a costume shop.

Costume Colossus, it was called on a huge yellow banner in red words and colossus indeed as the store was a two story yellow concrete building esp. for a place that seems to sell mainly costumes. The front of the store had some Halloween decorations near the sliding doors like hanging ghosts and bats, spider webs embedded on the wall with a huge spider on it, jack o’ lanterns on the side, and a scarecrow propped against a wall with hay surrounding it. Definitely ready for the upcoming holiday.

Veemon went through the double sliding doors and marveled at the interior. It definitely had that clothing store feel, similar to the ones on earth like JC Penny’s or Sears. Racks, tables, and shelves along the walls were littered with costumes, ranging from size to gender specifics to costume themes such as horror related, TV/movie characters, superhero costumes, etc. There were an up and down escalator leading towards the second floor that had more costumes. Dressing rooms were in the back of the store next to the restrooms. Near the doorway was a series of check out stations with cash registers. There was only one digimon, a Phantomon, manning a register that greeted him.

“Welcome to Costume Colossus! We have Halloween specials this month! Have a look at our wide selection!” he said with a strangely yet befitting haunting tone.

Wide seemed like an understatement to Veemon. More like gargantuan for a place that has two floors for costumes. He then wondered where would be a good place to look.

What floor did he choose?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Costume Colossus

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
He decided to stick with the bottom floor as it seemed to hold a ton of costumes already.

He looked around the area, checking out the shelves and racks that held costumes in plastic packaging. There were plenty of Halloween/horror related costumes including vampires/Dracula, Frankenstein monster, mummies, zombies, ghosts, pumpkins, werewolves and more. This also included horror movie villains and monsters such as Freddy Krueger, Swamp Monster, Godzilla, and others.

Another section had superhero themed costumes from Marvel, DC, and others like Captain America, Superman, The Hulk, Green Lantern, Wolverine, etc.

One section had costumes of actual Digimon from Wargreymon to Leomon to WereGarurumon to Machinedramon and more.

Then finally there was a section of miscellaneous costumes. Costumes from various cartoons/movies/TV/video games shows like Power Rangers, Hercules, Mario Bros., etc. There were occupational costumes and uniforms like cops, doctors, lumberjacks, sports gear like football uniforms, and even chippendale dancers. Animal costumes like dogs and cats, lions, bears, and elephants. There were pirates, knights and ninjas. And many more!

He wasn’t looking for anything specific though and wasn’t too picky on which costume. But the wide selection was overwhelming for him and deciding what to get was no easy task.

Which section of costumes does he look in?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
In a messy boy’s room, a desktop computer monitor screen flashed a bright light and Veemon appeared with his purchase shortly after the light had faded.

He ripped open the packaging and set the items on the bed, the diaper, the rattle, the bib and the bottle.

He grabbed the diaper and tried to put it on. It wasn’t too hard after fastening the tabs on each side, but it felt kinda weird with the padding rubbing against his crotch yet still pretty comfortable. He felt embarrassed by it and the crinkling of the diaper when he walked was annoying too. Though he was interested in the whole Self-Cleaning aspect of them and see how that goes. He then grabbed the bib and put it on around his neck and grabbed the rattle and bottle.

He walked over to the closet that had a full body mirror and his face turned a shade of red at his reflection. He definitely felt silly and thought of taking it off. However, a part of him wanted to keep it on so he can use to it and feel less embarrassed about it. After some debating in his head, he decided to leave the costume on.

He sat down on the bed and looked over to the bottle of milk he had in his hand and gotten very curious about it.

Was it really milk or some other type of liquid? Can he actually drink it? Does it taste good?

He shook the bottle, hearing sloshes and seeing air bubbles develop as a result. It looked okay and authentic and seemed still rather fresh without any kind of lumps or any signs of spoil.

He brought the nip to his lizard lips and began suckling on it. His eyes widen and choked on the drink. Not because that it tasted awful but that it tasted really good! Really sweet! Somewhat of an almond vanilla flavor. He continued to chug down the milk until the bottle was empty. He set down the bottle as it rolled right next to him on the bed.

“Urrrrrrppp!”

Veemon let out a loud burp slightly afterwards. Soon, he started to feel lightheaded and almost dizzy.

Then,

Veemon lied down on the bed, finding difficult to keep his eyes open until they were completely shut. Soon, he was on the train to Snoozeville with snores echoing throughout the room.

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
In an adolescent's room of the Motomiya household where dirty laundry was strewn between the closet and bed, a small white and blue dragon named Veemon sat on a computer, surfing the internet out of boredom ever since Davis left for school. Nothing was watchable on TV at the time, and he couldn't be able to go to the Digital World with the gate being down, and it was tough enough trying to go there without a digivice. So he was stuck there alone until his partner comes back.

Scrolling through a number of search pages and websites, he let out a yawn while clicking the mouse for a while. Then a pop up window got his attention.

All it said was: "Want to beat boredom?" With two buttons labeled Yes and No underneath.

Veemon was curious about what it is offering and with his current state, he clicked on Yes.

Another window blew up full screen showing a flashy advertising for a ____ game.

What kind of game is it?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Want to Beat Boredom?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
It was advertising some kind of fantasy RPG showcasing some basics such as swordplay along with a variety of other weapons to choose from, a plethora of magical spells, the numerous monsters to battle from trolls, goblins, dragons, etc. and the various detailed landscapes from forests to jungles to icy tundras. And promised these things and more in this one game.

A game called ____ .
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Fantasy RPG

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: A game called ____ .
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Enchanted Realms?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
The game's name does sound very inviting esp. with what had been advertised and why not try it out?

He downloaded the game which took nearly an hour to do so. But once it was uploaded, he got into setting up his username and password.

Then a small cinematic scene with your typical lore about the world with its monsters to wizards and warlocks to lands to boss villain overlords. Veemon clicked on the start game, only to meet with a blank white screen with some kind of questionnaire with asking for name, gender etc. It was odd as he expected to see some kind of character creation or character select screen like usual before getting the game started. But he filled it out anyway by typing his name and his gender.

Though the last question made him to go into deep thought: Which class do you like to choose? (Determines your beginning skill set; New classes available after certain levels)

The character classes are as followed: Warrior, Thief, Mage, Archer, Gunner, Barbarian and Brawler.

Which class did he choose?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Enchanted Realms

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
The barbarian option sounded appealing to the dragon mon and he clicked on the box next to the class of choice.

Then a small pop up window appeared that described the class in detail: Weapon: Great axes and War hammers, stats are low in MAG, SPD, DEX but high in ATK, DEF, STR, and has a very destructive skill tree with attacks in high damage and buffs that increase stat power.

After learning more about the class, it definitely was up his alley. Finalizing the choices, he clicked on the Start button at the button of the page. That caused another window to pop up saying "Your Adventure Now Awaits!" then the screen just went blank.

"Huh? What happened? Did it crash?" Veemon said as he clicked with the mouse and typed on the keyboard with no response. Suddenly, a great flash of light engulfed the whole room and he included as he felt himself getting sucked into the monitor. It didn't take long for him to black out.

Where does he wake up?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Veemon the Barbarian

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Where does he wake up?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Where does he wake up?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: In a Mountain?

choices: Follow Veemon's trek through the forest
Skip ahead to Veemon at the village
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
When Veemon came to, he sat up and found himself in a large room, definitely not Davis's as it looked less of a mess though twice as large.

It was a reddish brown cave with the mouth or opening about some few feet that he can see the clear cloudless sky. Looking around, he can see to his left some kind of ancient stove looking like a large stone brick with an opening on the side to put in the fire kindling and on top, two other holes with a pot on top. Near that was a small plain wooden table with a small stool and on the other side seemed to be a weapon rack of sorts that only held one weapon, a small ax. In the middle was a stone fire pit for light purposes and even cooking meat if the skewers and roast spit were any indication.

Sitting up, he realized that he was on a crude looking twin sized bed with brown blanket beneath him. But not only that, he was surprised as he looked down to see his body wearing beige undergarment with a bear pelt around his waist along with war paint covering certain areas of his body.

"It looks like I'm in the game somehow. And this my starting point. Or my house?" he thought out loud. He jumped off the bed and equipped his ax which looked more like a bigger hatchet. He went outside onto a wide round ledge that overlooked a sea of green, a vast forest and what looked like a clearing with a village with smoke coming from it. To his right was a pathway leading down towards the mountain's base.

"Time to start the game I guess!" he said as he followed the rocky path down.
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Mon of the Mountain

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Where does he wake up?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Desert

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Exactly where in the desert?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Near an Oasis?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Veemon came to with a start, staring at a small beige cloth like ceiling that seemed to move by an outside breeze. He realized he was in some kind of tent and sitting up, he found himself on top of a large blanket sheet or quilt with a pillow and to his side was a small ax and old canteen. He was also taken aback when he noticed the clothes he was wearing, grey loincloth with a wolf pelt and belt and silver wrist bracers and war paint markings covered much of his torso.

He crawled out of the tent to check his surroundings and was greeted with the hot beating sun in the cloudless sky. He was in a desert no doubt the endless sea of sand before him on all sides with a small campfire with skewers stuck in the ground with cooked lizards on them in front of the tent, but what had him in awe was the oasis in front of him. A lake size pool of pristine clear water that shimmers in the sun was surrounded by luscious palm trees and green shrubs and bushes around the entire rim. He approached the water to see his reflection, noticing more war paint on his face. He cupped his hands and took a drink, becoming wide eyed. It was delicious! He then hastily lapped up, quenching his thirst more than needed.

"Am I in the game? Doesn't look like any place in the DigiWorld." he said aloud as he got up.

Scanning the area, he then spotted something across the water, settling beneath a tree. Walking around, he discovered it to be a wooden treasure chest. Fortunately, it opened only to find...a gold compass necklace. Doesn't seem practical to put something like this in a chest if it has little to no value, but in RPG fashion it seems commonplace, proving that he is in the game along with his barbarian items. The compass will prove useful, but better if there was a map for clearer sense of direction.

"I guess it is time to start the game." he said to himself as he wore the compass around his neck.

He went back into his tent and grabbed the canteen to fill it up with water and equipped his ax. He decided to keep the tent here, just in case the need to come back along with a familiar landmark to have as a reference. He looked at the compass with the needle pointing on a big red N for North. Yet as said, he doesn't have a clue on where to go as in all directions there were nothing but sand dunes as far as the eye can see.

Which direction does he take?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Way Off in an Oasis

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Which direction does he take?
1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: South?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Veemon chosen to go down south to see if he can be able to find anything helpful to get him through the game, know what kind of objective to reach an end goal to beat the game.

However, nearly just an hour on his trek, the unbearable heat started to affect him and been experiencing fatigue. And he still hadn't found anything except just more sands and dunes. It didn't help that his water supply has gotten low too. He even contemplated about going back to the oasis to get more water and try another direction, but still pressed on, not wanting to waste more time and energy without any progress.

Soon, he stumbled upon a great dune that dwarfed the others, looking very mountainous. He groaned as made his way to the top, even using his ax as a walking stick as he struggle to climb. Once he had made it to the top, he managed to look over the horizon and saw____

What did he see?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
At the base of dune below, there was a treasure chest, not too dissimilar to the one at the oasis, made out of wood just partially buried in the sand.

Veemon quickly went down to it almost tripping along the away and hoping that it'll contain some kind nourishment for him to keep going. He approached the chest and thankfully, it wasn't locked so it opened without much effort.

What was in the chest?

1213322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
When he opened the chest, he reached in and grabbed a small vial shaped like a test tube with a cork on top and filled with a fluorescent bubbly blue liquid.

Despite looking glowing like it is radioactive, it actually looked fine to drink and probably taste refreshing too. And knowing some RPGs, he assumed that it was some kind of potion, probably restores health or magic points. Though would dehydration result in HP loss like a status affect like poison? Either way, it'll quench his thirst for now and save some water for later.

He popped off the cork and drank every last drop. It tasted surprisingly sweet. Then, Veemon felt slightly funny and a tingling crept throughout his body.

What happens next?

A few feet below from the base of the hill there was a wrecked overturned wagon partially buried in the sand with the back end and broken wheel exposed and the flaps waving in the wind. Next to the wreckage were some broken empty barrels and crates that seemed to be raided almost days or weeks ago. Maybe he could find something useful inside?

He went over to the spot, noticing some corners of nearly fully buried crates nearby. He peeked into the wagon to find some crates untouched, fortunately not buried and just turned over a bit. He was curious to see what was inside as he turned a nearby crate right side up. Using his axe, he pried open the lid and looked inside.

What was in the crate?

1313.content: What other ways to gain muscles?
1313.title: Other

13132.content:
Guilmon sighed as he made his way back to his old shed. It had been several years since he, and his fellow digimon had returned to the real world. It had been a happy reunion, Henry, and Terriormon tearing up, Takato and himself dancing and crying, Ryo and Monodramon celebrated with Ryo’s family, while Renamon and Rika in there, what Takato called ‘to cool attitude’, acknowledged each other. It had been a happy reunion all around, even Leomon returned thanks to the reset Henry’s father had performed, to the Tamers, and Jerry’s joy. It had beenone of the happiest days any of them had known ever.
Now however Guilmon was bored. Takato was in his last year of middle school, and finals where going on. Guilmon was now staying with Takato’s family, so he didn’t have to stay at the old shed, but due to how busy Takato was Guilmon had been left bored, and was now looking for a way to entertain himself. The squirrels around the park always ran away, and there weren’t many digimon around today, do it was just Guilmon and his thoughts. While Guilmon had matured somewhat over the last few years he still had some of his childish demeaner. This sometimes lead to him getting into trouble, but he was getting better.
It wasn’t long before Guilmon saw his shed in the distance still sitting on the hill in the back of the park, same as before the d-reaper incident, though it looked like someone had filled in the hole Guilmon had dug to store his bread. Guilmon frowned as he opened the gate, and went in sniffing tentivly. No new scents in the air, other than earth and...
Guilmon sniffed picking up a sweet scent seemingly coming from where his hole had been, approaching Guilmon noticed that some of the earth was freshly dug up. Gettting close guilmon began to dig, pushing away a patch of dirt in the far back of the shed. Not long after Guilmon pulled out a box fromt the dirt. It looked kind of like a packet of bottled sodas, but the lable showed an arm flexing, bulging with muscle. Guilmon tried to scrape awa more of the dirt and make out the words “pah- pow… Power... Powe N?”
The label had been worn away, having been buried for some time, the second half of the label almost completely gone, Guilmon curious sniffed the bottles picking up a vanilla scent from them, Guilmon wondered if he should drink one, or not, but then again, it had been a while since lunch, and one couldn’t hurt.

info.brief_description: Give Digimon mountains of muscle in a multitude of ways!
info.description:
Make the digimon from seasons 1-3 into muscle bound hulks and do almost anything else to them.

Some rules to establish:

1. Keep it mainly focused on muscle growth. Anything else is okay except for weight gain, scat and watersports. I'm okay with digimon being fat/WG at the beginning of the story and slim down with MG later, but they can't gain the fat back.
2. Only digimon can experience muscle growth, but humans can be involved with the stories as well.
3. Sex is allowed.
4. No death or killing off the main chars.
5. Have fun!
